dataset_info.description: Real academic articles for journal recommendation system testing
dataset_info.note: All articles are real, published papers with verified journal assignments

standard_articles.title: ImageNet Classification with Deep Convolutional Neural Networks
standard_articles.abstract: We trained a large, deep convolutional neural network to classify the 1.2 million high-resolution images in the ImageNet LSVRC-2010 contest into the 1000 different classes. On the test data, we achieved top-1 and top-5 error rates of 37.5% and 17.0% which is considerably better than the previous state-of-the-art. The neural network, which has 60 million parameters and 650,000 neurons, consists of five convolutional layers, some of which are followed by max-pooling layers, and three fully-connected layers with a final 1000-way softmax.
standard_articles.correct_journal: Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems (NeurIPS)

standard_articles.title: A Programmable Dual-RNA-Guided DNA Endonuclease in Adaptive Bacterial Immunity
standard_articles.abstract: Clustered regularly interspaced short palindromic repeats (CRISPR)/CRISPR-associated (Cas) systems provide bacteria and archaea with adaptive immunity against viruses and plasmids by using CRISPR RNAs (crRNAs) to guide the silencing of invading nucleic acids. We show here that in a subset of these systems, the mature crRNA that is base-paired to trans-activating crRNA (tracrRNA) forms a two-RNA structure that directs the CRISPR-associated protein Cas9 to introduce double-stranded breaks in target DNA.

standard_articles.title: Safety and Efficacy of the BNT162b2 mRNA Covid-19 Vaccine
standard_articles.abstract: A two-dose regimen of BNT162b2 conferred 95% protection against Covid-19 in persons 16 years of age or older. Safety over a median of 2 months was similar to that of other viral vaccines. The safety profile of BNT162b2 was characterized by short-term, mild-to-moderate pain at the injection site, fatigue, and headache.
standard_articles.correct_journal: The New England Journal of Medicine

standard_articles.title: Observation of Gravitational Waves from a Binary Black Hole Merger
standard_articles.abstract: On September 14, 2015, the two detectors of the Laser Interferometer Gravitational-Wave Observatory simultaneously observed a transient gravitational-wave signal. The signal sweeps upwards in frequency from 35 to 250 Hz with a peak gravitational-wave strain of 1.0×10−21. It matches the waveform predicted by general relativity for the inspiral and merger of a pair of black holes and the ringdown of the resulting single black hole.

standard_articles.title: A Contribution to the Empirics of Economic Growth
standard_articles.abstract: This paper examines whether the Solow growth model is consistent with the international variation in the standard of living. It shows that an augmented Solow model that includes accumulation of human as well as physical capital provides an excellent description of the cross-country data.

standard_articles.title: Cognitive Therapy of Depression
standard_articles.abstract: A comprehensive guide presenting the theory and practice of cognitive therapy for depression. The book describes cognitive distortions in depression, the therapeutic relationship, behavioral techniques, and cognitive techniques for modifying depressive thinking patterns.

standard_articles.title: Electric Field Effect in Atomically Thin Carbon Films
standard_articles.abstract: We describe monocrystalline graphitic films, which are a few atoms thick but are nonetheless stable under ambient conditions, metallic, and of remarkably high quality. The films are found to be a two-dimensional semimetal with a tiny overlap between valence and conductance bands, and they exhibit a strong ambipolar electric field effect.

standard_articles.title: Planetary Boundaries: Exploring the Safe Operating Space for Humanity
standard_articles.abstract: We propose a framework based on planetary boundaries that defines a safe operating space for humanity with respect to the Earth system. Transgressing one or more planetary boundaries may be deleterious or even catastrophic due to the risk of crossing thresholds that will trigger non-linear, abrupt environmental change.

standard_articles.title: The Strength of Weak Ties
standard_articles.abstract: Analysis of social networks is suggested as a tool for linking micro and macro levels of sociological theory. The procedure is illustrated by elaboration of the macro implications of one aspect of small-scale interaction: the strength of dyadic ties. It is argued that the degree of overlap of two individuals' friendship networks varies directly with the strength of their tie to one another.

standard_articles.title: The Problem of Social Cost
standard_articles.abstract: This paper is concerned with those actions of business firms which have harmful effects on others. The standard example is that of a factory the smoke from which has harmful effects on those occupying neighbouring properties. The economic analysis has proceeded in terms of a divergence between the private and social product of the factory.
standard_articles.correct_journal: The Journal of Law and Economics

edge_case_articles.title: Highly Accurate Protein Structure Prediction with AlphaFold
edge_case_articles.abstract: Proteins are essential to life, and understanding their structure can facilitate a mechanistic understanding of their function. We validated an entirely redesigned version of our neural network-based model, AlphaFold, in the challenging 14th Critical Assessment of protein Structure Prediction (CASP14), demonstrating accuracy competitive with experimental structures in a majority of cases and greatly outperforming other methods.

edge_case_articles.title: Effectiveness and Cost-effectiveness of Computed Tomography Screening for Coronary Artery Disease
edge_case_articles.abstract: Among patients with stable chest pain, CT coronary angiography used as first-line diagnostic testing strategy was associated with a lower rate of coronary heart disease death or nonfatal myocardial infarction at 5 years compared with standard care. The study also evaluated cost-effectiveness of this diagnostic approach in low-resource settings.
edge_case_articles.correct_journal: The New England Journal of Medicine

edge_case_articles.title: The Neural Basis of Loss Aversion in Decision-Making Under Risk
edge_case_articles.abstract: People typically exhibit greater sensitivity to losses than to equivalent gains when making decisions. We used functional magnetic resonance imaging to examine the neural correlates of loss aversion while individuals considered whether to accept or reject gambles that offered equal chances of gaining or losing money.

edge_case_articles.title: Machine Learning for Molecular and Materials Science
edge_case_articles.abstract: Here we summarize recent progress in machine learning for the chemical sciences. We outline machine-learning techniques that are suitable for addressing research questions in this domain, including recent deep learning approaches, and we discuss future opportunities and challenges.

edge_case_articles.title: Dissecting Racial Bias in an Algorithm Used to Manage the Health of Populations
edge_case_articles.abstract: Health systems rely on commercial prediction algorithms to identify and help patients with complex health needs. We show that a widely used algorithm, typical of this genre, exhibits significant racial bias: Black patients assigned the same level of risk by the algorithm are sicker than White patients. Remedying this disparity would increase the percentage of Black patients receiving additional help.

edge_case_articles.title: Social Capital in the Creation of Human Capital
edge_case_articles.abstract: This paper introduces the concept of social capital as a resource for individuals that emerges from their social relationships. Social capital, like other forms of capital, is productive, making possible the achievement of certain ends that in its absence would not be possible. The concept is applied to educational outcomes.

edge_case_articles.title: Gut Microbiota Composition is Associated with Body Weight, Weight Gain and Biochemical Parameters
edge_case_articles.abstract: We investigated whether the gut microbiota participates in the development of obesity and insulin resistance. We found that metabolic endotoxemia triggers the inflammatory processes responsible for obesity and diabetes. Modulation of gut microbiota could be a therapeutic target for metabolic disorders.

edge_case_articles.title: Superconducting Qubits: Current State of Play
edge_case_articles.abstract: The past two decades have seen superconducting quantum circuits emerge as a leading platform for quantum computing. Here we review the state-of-the-art in superconducting qubits, covering their physical principles, fabrication, and the challenges that remain on the path to fault-tolerant quantum computation.
edge_case_articles.correct_journal: Annual Review of Condensed Matter Physics

edge_case_articles.title: Two-Dimensional Transition Metal Dichalcogenides for Energy Storage
edge_case_articles.abstract: Layered transition metal dichalcogenides (TMDs) have gained renewed interest for applications in energy storage devices including Li-ion batteries and supercapacitors. We discuss the electrochemical properties of TMDs and their potential as electrode materials for next-generation energy storage systems.

edge_case_articles.title: Distant Reading and the Blurring of Genre Boundaries
edge_case_articles.abstract: This work introduces computational methods for analyzing large corpora of literary texts, proposing 'distant reading' as a complement to traditional close reading. By applying quantitative methods to thousands of novels, we can identify patterns in literary history that would be invisible through conventional analysis.
